Topic.Title: Is there any way to place the objects list beneath the room description?

Posts.EditableText:
http://i.imgur.com/tALVlRQ.png

Pretty much, I want the objects to be listed once I've already finished explaining the context in which they're held. I don't know why it isn't like that by default, but is there any way to change it?
Posts.HTML:
http://i.imgur.com/tALVlRQ.png

Pretty much, I want the objects to be listed once I've already finished explaining the context in which they're held. I don't know why it isn't like that by default, but is there any way to change it?

Posts.EditableText: Ooo! I'm a newbie but I found it while exploring the program earlier. Go to "game" in the tree, then click on the Room Description tab. Towards the bottom is the Room Description options, which lets you change the order of the info displayed for each room is.
Posts.HTML: Ooo! I'm a newbie but I found it while exploring the program earlier. Go to "game" in the tree, then click on the Room Description tab. Towards the bottom is the Room Description options, which lets you change the order of the info displayed for each room is.

Posts.EditableText: You're a lifesaver, thank you! I'm trying to make my first game, and that would've bugged me senseless.
Posts.HTML: You're a lifesaver, thank you! I'm trying to make my first game, and that would've bugged me senseless.

Posts.EditableText:
nice find, Emma! You're already helping people, hehe :D

the 'game' Game Object has a lot of the global/game settings/controls/options, there's a lot of really useful ones (and some I'm still not quite sure what they do / are for, lol), especially all of the settings/options under the 'Room Descriptions' Tab.

Also, it has the 'features' Tab, which toggles on/off many features (as, as quest got updated over the versions, too many Tabs were cluttering up the GUI~Editor, so now many of them are hidden, until you toggle them on through the 'game' Game Object's 'Features' Tab)

Also, each individual Object has its own options/settings too, again such as under its 'Room Descriptions' Tab, which you can use, if you don't want such settings to be applied to the entire game / if you don't want them being applied to every object.

--------

also, you may want to get in touch with 'Anonynn' as she's/he's (no idea if the user is male or female - seems female  --- but as a guy, my intuition is lousy, laughs) been learning quest a lot, and been making a game (warning: it's an adult game - though I don't think it's too extreme.. but not sure as I've not tried playing it yet), and can probably help you with stuff. Also, there's 'XanMag' too (can't know for certain if this user is male or female as well, lol), as he doesn't know much coding, and can be a big help to you, as well.
Posts.HTML:
nice find, Emma! You're already helping people, hehe :D

the 'game' Game Object has a lot of the global/game settings/controls/options, there's a lot of really useful ones (and some I'm still not quite sure what they do / are for, lol), especially all of the settings/options under the 'Room Descriptions' Tab.

Also, it has the 'features' Tab, which toggles on/off many features (as, as quest got updated over the versions, too many Tabs were cluttering up the GUI~Editor, so now many of them are hidden, until you toggle them on through the 'game' Game Object's 'Features' Tab)

Also, each individual Object has its own options/settings too, again such as under its 'Room Descriptions' Tab, which you can use, if you don't want such settings to be applied to the entire game / if you don't want them being applied to every object.

also, you may want to get in touch with 'Anonynn' as she's/he's (no idea if the user is male or female - seems female --- but as a guy, my intuition is lousy, laughs) been learning quest a lot, and been making a game (warning: it's an adult game - though I don't think it's too extreme.. but not sure as I've not tried playing it yet), and can probably help you with stuff. Also, there's 'XanMag' too (can't know for certain if this user is male or female as well, lol), as he doesn't know much coding, and can be a big help to you, as well.
